title: Remark raises $16M to build out human-powered expert models for e-commerce
snippet: Startups working on AI-powered e-commerce tools often rely on external data or user signals to build and improve their models. But Remark lets thousands of human experts chat with users while they are purchasing items, and then using that knowledge to train models.

title: Cino cracks bill-splitting at the moment of payment, raises seed round

title: Deloitte sees BFCM shopper turnout climb, Gen Z drives momentum
snippet: Younger consumers continue to reshape holiday retail dynamics, with 72 percent planning to shop in store on Black Friday compared to 49 percent of all shoppers.

title: Sales lessons learned for jewellers ahead of all-important holidays
snippet: The latest analysis of sales at independent jewellery stores in Australia has uncovered many interesting trends in November.

title: JAA appoints seventh director to board
snippet: The Jewellers Association of Australia (JAA) has announced the appointment of a seventh director, Lindsay Kotzman.

title: Consumer watchdog issues new warning about ghost stores
snippet: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) is warning consumers and retailers to be vigilant about online retail scammers posing as local businesses during the holiday season.

title: Impractical regulations set to disrupt gift card transactions
snippet: Retail industry representatives are warning about the unintended consequences of recent changes to Australia’s anti-money laundering and counter terrorism-financing regime, particularly as it concerns gift cards.

title: Australian retailers encouraged to plan for a productive holiday period
snippet: Industry forecasters are anticipating strong holiday sales for Australian retailers, with shoppers expected to spend heavily during the all-important trading period.

title: Former Jewellery Industry Network directors issue statement
snippet: Jeweller recently reported on the dramatic multi-million dollar collapse of several companies associated with the Jewellery Industry Network and now two former directors have issued a statement ‘clearing the air’ regarding their decision to exit the company.

title: Buying group announces 2026 board changes
snippet: Showcase Jewellers has announced a number of changes to its board.

title: Surprising twist in Jewellery Industry Network connections and collapses
snippet: In recent weeks, Jeweller has painstakingly documented the collapse of seven companies that share some unusual connections with two of the founding directors of the Jewellery Industry Network.

title: Beauty & Flaw: Nothing lasts forever
snippet: Suggesting a shift in perspective, Daniel Nyfeler proposes that the industry should embrace the individuality conveyed by inclusions, as the traditional narrative of diamond perfection has lost some of its appeal.

title: Legacy of Clarity: GIA updates diamond reports to reflect market
snippet: Reflecting changes in the market, the GIA (Gemological Institute of America) has updated its diamond reports.

title: Natural Diamonds: Nature’s Mic Drop
snippet: Elevating natural diamonds as symbols of both authenticity and responsible sourcing, Feriel Zerouki draws a distinct contrast with lab-created diamonds and what she sees as their potentially misleading marketing tactics.

title: Strictly speaking, about synthetics
snippet: Gaetano Cavalieri affirms that CIBJO’s primary mission is to guarantee the industry’s operations are conducted with complete transparency, ensuring all products are described with accuracy and without ambiguity.

title: Natural or Synthetic Diamonds:  Education is more important than ever
snippet: Protecting consumers through education and accurate identification, Ian Dun emphasizes the Gemmological Association of Australia’s commitment to distinguishing between natural and synthetic diamonds.

title: Consumers wisely opt for the superior product: Lab-created diamonds
snippet: Consumers are increasingly opting for lab-created diamonds, a superior product driven by affordability, technological advancements and changing consumer attitudes, asserts Martin Roscheisen.

title: Trust and transparency remain critical  in an evolving diamond industry
snippet: Sally Morrison stresses the crucial roles of trust and transparency within the diamond industry, especially concerning lab-created diamonds, while also showcasing De Beers’ initiatives designed to bolster consumer confidence in natural diamonds.

title: Seismic shifts that will shape jewellery retail for the next 40 years
snippet: Marty Hurwitz draws attention to the significant shifts occurring in jewellery retail, noting the marked increase in demand for custom-made pieces using lab-created diamonds, particularly amongst younger generations.

title: Consumers hold an enduring love for natural diamonds
snippet: David Kellie underscores the enduring consumer affection for natural diamonds, emphasising their inherent rarity, unquestionable authenticity, and the significantly positive impact of the natural diamond industry on communities across the globe.

title: Diamonds & Ice: Nobody likes change
snippet: Drawing a compelling historical parallel, Tom Chatham equates the diamond industry’s evolution to the natural ice trade’s trajectory, suggesting that efficient and cost-effective products are destined to prevail.

title: Natural diamonds: Clean your house first!
snippet: Garry Holloway champions the cause of improved consumer confidence in natural diamonds by advocating for honest and transparent diamond grading reports, directly addressing the flaws he sees in the current grading system.

title: The Mark: Natural diamonds need to be more easily identifiable
snippet: For enhanced consumer confidence and to clearly differentiate natural stones, Paul Zimnisky makes a compelling argument for physically marking natural diamonds as a definitive form of authentication.

title: Lab-created diamonds are in fashion
snippet: Joshua Freedman observes the increasing acceptance of lab-created diamonds in fashion jewellery, pinpointing Signet Jewellers’ success as evidence of shifting consumer perceptions.

title: Will diamonds shine forever? Eight steps to securing a brighter future
snippet: Emphasising the critical need for market stabilisation, Robert Bouquet discusses the multifaceted challenges confronting the natural diamond industry, including the growing impact of lab-created diamonds, oversupply issues, and consistently weak prices.

title: Diamonds: A small piece of a large puzzle
snippet: Signifying a change in how we perceive reality and value, Samuel Ord analyses how lab-grown diamonds are shifting perceptions and the value we place on diamonds.

title: The Great Diamond Debate III: Passion vs Tension
snippet: Seven years after the inaugural Great Diamond Debate, the diamond landscape is almost unrecognisable. Natural and laboratory-created stones now share a stage transformed by technology, shifting values, and new rules of engagement. In this edition, leading voices worldwide reveal how the story has evolved – and where it’s heading next!

title: What becomes of the broken-hearted?
snippet: Angela Han argues that once ‘breach of promise to marry’ laws were abolished, diamond rings stopped being legal protection and started functioning as financial collateral. What's changed, and what does this mean for the broken-hearted?

title: Jewellery chain collapses; Administrator appointed
snippet: The 23-store fashion jewellery retailer Secrets Shhh has been placed under administration with hope the business can be sold.

title: Now Showing: How to use psychology to sell luxury items; The online shopping fraud you may not know about; Inside the 2025 Gold Boom
snippet: Take a few moments to enjoy Jeweller's Friday Flicks video selection, including updates on current affairs and insights into the jewellery trade. This week, learn how psychology can be used to sell luxury items, uncover an online shopping fraud many people don’t know about, and take a closer look inside the 2025 gold boom.

title: Quantum diamond foundry opens in Victoria
snippet: The Victorian Government has announced the opening of a quantum diamond technology foundry, based in Notting Hill, south east of Melbourne.

title: Diamond Foundry receives funding boost in Spain
snippet: Spain’s government has announced a significant investment in a lab-created diamond manufacturing plant operated by Diamond Foundry.

title: Mysterious monster emerald showcased by military ruler
snippet: Amid extensive political turmoil in Madagascar, an unusual colour gemstone has been thrust into the spotlight.

title: Diamonds from Earth and Lab:  Facts, Opportunities, & Transparency
snippet: Tehmasp Printer makes the point that natural and lab-created diamonds may differ in origin, but they share the same brilliance, value and a rightful place within today’s market.

title: Love & Marriage: Changing attitudes & your jewellery store
snippet: SAMUEL ORD takes a closer look at the evolving attitude towards marriage in Australia and what this means for independent jewellery store owners.

title: Jewellery Industry Network: Connecting the dots in a $14 million collapse
snippet: Jeweller recently documented the collapse of eight companies that, on the surface, seem largely unrelated – operating in diverse and disparate industries – sharing little more than some unusual connections to the Australian jewellery industry.

title: Athan Wholesale Jewellers
snippet: Crafted in Italy and offered in 9, 14, and 18-carat gold, Athan’s Omega necklaces come in yellow, white, and two-tone finishes.

title: Coeur de Lion
snippet: This statement necklace features a harmonious blend of warm blue and soft purple hues in natural Chalcedony, Onyx, Haematite, Swarovski Crystals and rhinestone rondelles, set in a sleek stainless steel design.

title: Ikecho Australia
snippet: The Ethereal Pearl Necklace captures timeless elegance with delicate freshwater pearls spaced along a fine chain, creating an effortless look of sophistication.

title: UNOde50
snippet: UNOde50’s unique, organic style creates bold statement pieces that truly stand out.

title: Sapphire Dreams
snippet: Unique and beautiful, the Numilla necklace showcases an arrangement of marquise-cut Australian sapphires and a single sparkling white diamond.

title: Athan Wholesale Jewellers
snippet: A classic redefined: Athan’s Figaro chains are available in both 9 and 18-carat yellow gold, ranging from 2 mm to 3.9 mm in gauge and in various lengths.

title: Ikecho Australia
snippet: Made from exquisite AA-grade Japanese Akoya pearls, the Geisha Necklace embodies timeless elegance and refined beauty.

title: Ellendale Diamonds Australia
snippet: An 18-carat white and yellow gold pendant featuring a striking black opal from Lightning Ridge, framed by a flowing arrangement of Argyle white diamonds.

title: Ellendale Diamonds Australia
snippet: An 18-carat yellow and white gold pendant showcasing a luminous white opal from Coober Pedy, accentuated by a graceful curve of Argyle white diamonds.

title: Critical step forward in the fight for Australia's jewellery apprentice
snippet: There’s been a significant victory   in the campaign to ease the pressures of rising demand and secure a brighter future for the Australian jewellery industry.

title: Assay offices call for reform of Hallmarking law
snippet:
The four UK Assay Offices have issued a joint open letter to MPs urging action in reforming the Hallmarking Act 1973. This open letter is fully supported by the National Association of Jewellers (NAJ). Hallmarking remains a cornerstone of consumer protection, providing independent assurance of precious metal quality and safeguarding public trust in jewellery and […]
The post Assay offices call for reform of Hallmarking law appeared first on Professional Jeweller.

title: Hugh Rice appoints new retail director
snippet:
Hugh Rice the Jewellers has announced the appointment of Hannah Hirst to the board of directors as retail director. Hirst, who has been serving as the company’s procurement manager, brings a wealth of experience, strong brand partnerships, and a deep understanding of the business. In her new role, Hirst will work closely with store managers […]

title: Wongs Jewellers debuts new Manchester store today
snippet:
Manchester’s Arndale Centre welcomes Wongs Jewellers today, marking its first expansion outside Liverpool. With a legacy spanning over four decades, Wongs Jewellers brings its signature elegance, heritage, and playful design to Manchester for the first time. Now, after 45 years in the making, Wongs Jewellers is opening a store that celebrates the family legacy while […]

title: Applications open for Goldsmiths’ Centre Getting Started Online course
snippet:
The Goldsmiths’ Centre is now accepting applications for Getting Started Online, a free, one-week intensive business course. Running online from 9–13 March 2026, the course is accessible to participants across the UK and serves as a gateway to further opportunities, including Spotlighting Getting Started and Shine, while connecting participants to the Goldsmiths’ Centre’s creative community. title: Saddle up 2026: Thomas Sabo celebrates the year of the Horse
snippet:
Thomas Sabo is starting the new year with a trio of collections that celebrate the Year of the Horse, symbolising freedom, energy, and ambition. The Horse stands for passionate energy and courageous decisions. This is reflected in the Elyndra, Wild Horses and Good Luck Rodeo collections. With elegance, they interpret the fascination of the horse […]

title: Richemont UK outperforms rival groups with 5% rise in sales
snippet:
Richemont‘s watch and jewellery business has generated record sales in the UK with turnover rising 5.3% to £277 million in 2024-25. The group’s latest accounts cover the 12 months to March 1 2025. Operating profit surged by 155% to £32 million. The results cover retail and wholesale for jewellery and watchmakers, but do not include […]

title: The Goldsmiths’ Centre to spotlights emerging talent in New Year
snippet:
The Goldsmiths’ Centre is set to hold Spotlighting Getting Started, a free public exhibition championing the work of 15 emerging jewellers and silversmiths. From 12 January to 18 February 2026, the exhibition will showcase over 50 independent designers utilising a range of contemporary practices. Visitors can explore techniques from Japonisme-inspired motifs and ocean forms captured […]

title: 12 Days of Dazzle Day 12: Sonja T. Jewelry
snippet:
Sonja T. Jewelry is renowned for transforming emotional depth and cultural heritage into exquisite pieces of fine filigree. The latest creation, the Filigree Crown Bear Pendant, is more than just an accessory; it is a regal, modern heirloom. This unique piece reimagines a nostalgic childhood companion with the precision of haute joaillerie, making it a […]

title: Gerald Ratner agitates to buy back Ernest Jones and H. Samuel
snippet:
Gerald Ratner is trying to buy H. Samuel and Ernest Jones, the UK retail marques owned by US-based Signet Jewelers, 34 years after losing control of the business. Ratner famously described jewellery sold by what was then named Ratners Group as “total crap” in a speech to the Institute of Directors in 1991, and was […]
